answerText: Plutus [10] Plutus is a play by this author of Lysistrata and The Frogs.
heading: VCU Closed  |2013 | Chicago C & South Carolina A | 18 | Literature | Classical | College
subject: Literature
question: Question: In this play, the slave Cario reminisces about impersonating a snake in the Temple of Asclepius in order to steal an old lady's last bit of rotten food for no reason. For 10 points each: [10] Name this play, in which Chremylus asks the Delphic Oracle what values to teach his son, and is told to become a disciple of the next man he meets.
